Package sprites

Class Enemy

java.lang.Object
sprites.Enemy
All Implemented Interfaces:
GameVariables
Direct Known Subclasses:
Ghost, Mage
public abstract class Enemy extends Object implements GameVariables
This file holds Enemy.java, Mage, Ghost, EnemyFactory, MageFactory, and GhostFactory. These are the classes used to create enemies including loading their images, storing their locations, and drawing to the screen. Mage and Ghost are child classes of Enemy and MageFactory and GhostFactory are child classes of EnemyFactory.
Since:
March 26, 2024
Author:
Andrew Denegar

  • Field Details

    • activeEnemies

      public static final Set<Enemy> activeEnemies
      List of all enemies currently visible on the screen. This is static for easier access for collision detection.

      List of all enemies. This is static for easier access for collision detection.

  • Method Details

    • calculateDistance

      public static double calculateDistance(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
      Calculates the distance between two points using the distance formula.
      Parameters:
      x1 - First x coordinate.
      y1 - First y coordinate.
      x2 - Second x coordinate.
      y2 - Second y coordinate.
      Returns:
      The distance between the two points.

    • enemyCollision

      public static List<Enemy> enemyCollision(Enemy eOne, int newX, int newY)
      Checks for a collision between eOne and all enemies in activeEnemies.
      Parameters:
      eOne - The enemy to use.
      newX - The x coordinate to use.
      newY - The y coordinate to use.
      Returns:
      true if there's a collision.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Main method, used for testing.
      Parameters:
      args - Arguments passed.

    • canAttack

      public boolean canAttack(int x, int y)
      Checks if the enemy is close enough to the player to attack.
      Parameters:
      x - The x coordinate to use.
      y - The y coordinate to use.
      Returns:
      true If the enemy is closer enough to attack.

    • changeState

      public void changeState(int x, int y)
      Changes state and direction of Enemy depending on values of x and y. If x and y both don't equal 0, then the enemy is moving, else, it's idle. If s is positive, the enemy is moving east, else its moving west.
      Parameters:
      x - x coordinate to check.
      y - y coordinate to check.

    • draw

      public boolean draw(Graphics2D g)
      Draw the enemy to the screen. Return true if the enemy should be removed from the enemy list. This happens when the death animation moves through a full loop of the death images.
      Parameters:
      g - Graphics2D object used for drawing.
      Returns:
      true if this enemy should be removed from the enemy list.

    • facePlayer

      public void facePlayer()
      Changes the direction the enemy is facing so it's always facing the player.

    • getHeight

      public int getHeight()
      Gets the height of the enemy.
      Returns:
      The height of the enemy.

    • getHitCount

      public int getHitCount()
      Return the current health of enemy (how many more hits they can sustain).
      Returns:
      hitCount how many times the enemy can be hit before fainting.

    • getPosition

      public int[] getPosition()
      Gets the actual position of the enemy.
      Returns:
      The actual position of the enemy.

    • getSpeed

      public int getSpeed()
      Gets the speed of the enemy.
      Returns:
      The speed of the enemy.

    • getState

      public GameVariables.State getState()
      What is the current state of our enemy?
      Returns:
      the current state of our enemy.

    • getWidth

      public int getWidth()
      Gets the width of the enemy.
      Returns:
      The width of the enemy.

    • inRangeOfPlayer

      public boolean inRangeOfPlayer()
      Checks if the enemy is in range of the player so it can start moving towards the player.
      Returns:
      true if the enemy is in range of the player.

    • isVisible

      public boolean isVisible()
      Checks if the enemy is currently visible on the screen.
      Returns:
      true if the Enemy is currently visible on the screen.

    • knockback

      public void knockback(GameVariables.Facing d)
      Determines which direction to knockback the enemy, and sets knockback-related variables to true;
      Parameters:
      d - The direction to knockback the enemy.

    • move

      public void move()
      Move decides how the enemy should move based on the player position and current position, if the enemy can see the player, and if the enemy has gotten hit or not.

    • newPosition

      public int[] newPosition()
      Finds a new position for the enemy. It first finds the distance between the player and the enemy. It then checks all possible directions it can move. If the move would result in a smaller distance to the player, and wouldn't result in a collision between a wall or a enemy, then it's considered a valid move.
      Returns:
      A 2D array of integers, which are the enemies new coordinates.

    • resetHitCount

      public void resetHitCount()
      Set player health back to 100

    • resetKnockback

      public void resetKnockback()
      Stops and resets the knockback effect.

    • roam

      public void roam()
      Moves the enemy back and forth when it's not tracking the player.

    • subtractHitCount

      public void subtractHitCount(int amount)
      Subtract health from the enemy.
      Parameters:
      amount - The amount of health to subtract.

    • wallCollision

      public boolean wallCollision(int x, int y)
      Checks for a collision between the enemy and the walls in ChunkManager.activeChunks.
      Parameters:
      x - The x coordinate to use.
      y - The y coordinate to use.
      Returns:
      true if there is a collision between any wall in any chunk.

    • update_coords

      private void update_coords(int dx, int dy)
      Update the position of the enemy.
      Parameters:
      dx - horizontal shift in the enemy's position.
      dy - vertical shift in the enemy's position.
